rename.from: Negative values are not correctly displayed in `BarChartColumn` and `AreaChartColumn`
rename.to: Negative values are not correctly displayed in `*ChartColumn`

body:
A weird observation:
with `data_df = pd.DataFrame({"sales": [[100, 0, 200], [50, -50, 150]]})`
even after applying the `y_min` and `y_max`, the area and line charts do not go below 0:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/293b1a36-b1bd-4563-ad20-68b09abd819e)
@Abdelgha-4 Thanks for reporting this issue. I was able to reproduce it [here](https://issues.streamlit.app/?issue=gh-10411). This is caused by how we currently normalize the data.

Thanks!
Until this gets fixed I'll be using `st.columns` to produce similar looking results.
For that I have one question: how to reproduce the charts used in `*ChartColumn` without using `st.dataframe` ?
(Especially the AreaChart and LineChart with smooth curves)
@Abdelgha-4 you might want to go a bit deeper into altair or plotly chart specs :) Those charting specs definitely have some ways to achieve this.

Hi @lukasmasuch @Abdelgha-4 

I was able to replicate this issue and would like to contribute by working on a fix.
Would it be possible to assign it to me?

Thanks in advance!

Hello @tiagorb1, Thank you for your interest
I don't know who is responsible for assigning issues, but I think you are welcome create a PR and it'll be reviewed and accepted if it solves the issue.
